summary: This bill, H.R. 235, the "National Museum of Play Recognition Act," proposes to officially designate the Margaret Woodbury Strong Museum in Rochester, New York, as the "National Museum of Play." The bill recognizes the museum's unique focus on exploring play's role in learning, creativity, and cultural history. The designation is honorific and explicitly states that the museum will not become part of the National Park System. It also clarifies that the recognition does not authorize or permit any federal funds to be spent on the museum.
